term.title: syntectic reaction

item.text: A reversible reaction that involves the conversion of two liquid phases, l' and l'', into a solid phase α on cooling: The maximum temperature at which this reaction can occur is the congruent melting point of the solid phase. Example: The conversion of co-existing K-rich and Zn-rich phases in the K-Zn system to form an intermediate solid phase KZn13.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 577. 'Definitions of terms relating to phase transitions of the solid state (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 592 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466030577)
